intro: Brunfelsia brasiliensis, commonly known as the angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes other nightshade plants. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture.
